title: Ask HN: Europe: Are you preparing for electrical blackouts, how?
text:
So, while "unlikely" (just as many things that happen all the time), we've been told here in Denmark, that we could expect unannounced 2-hour interruptions of electricity.

I'm seriously considering throwing money on a diesel generator with automatic start/switchover, while not a true UPS, it will at least reduce the service downtime, and then the battery UPS can catch the PC and network while the diesel starts. This require me to rewire/rethink some of my electrical connections, but I figure I can make something managable that is not too permanent (basically, draw industrial extention cords to vital items like the boiler, circulation pumps, fridge/freezer, and luxury things like computer/network/tv.

Your thoughts and considerations ?

Ask HN: Why do software tutorials use meaningless GIFs?
text: I'm building a few hobby projects in what is a new language for me, so the first step was to search for tutorials online. But it seems to be a trend to use gifs from movies and elsewhere to populate whitespace in most tutorials and videos. As someone who is an outsider, what is the reason for this? Well if it is to add a touch of humor to the video or blog post, it certainly doesn't work - on the contrary, it's irritating and distracting.

Ask HN: How to mitigate the impact of the incoming economic crisis in Europe?
text:
It's not totally clear (at least to me) how serious this crisis is going to be. I don't know what to expect exactly, besides a big increase in bills and essential goods.

In this situation, what steps should one take to minimize the impact of this incoming recession? Both financially and otherwise.
